creditline: Gift of Bill and Krista Thorburn
description: abstract landscape with high horizon line; orange sky; blue band (water?) at horizon line; irregular rock formations in tan, orange, purple, blue, black and green
image_copyright: © Estate of George Morrison %2F Briand Morrison
medium: Pen and colored inks on paper
provenance: The artist; Hazel Belvo, Minneapolis; (Bockley Gallery, Minneapolis, sold to Thorburn); Krista and William Thorburn, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2017.
text: Among the final works Morrison created during his six-decade career, this boldly colored, abstract landscape encapsulates the artist’s creative philosophy and aesthetic vision. From his reliance on Surrealist-inspired automatic drawing techniques and expressive use of color, to the prominent horizon line motif and the theme of Lake Superior as both a symbol and source of spiritual knowledge, this drawing operates as a sort of visual and aesthetic manifesto, and fitting homage to Morrison’s distinguished career.
title: Untitled (Lake Superior Landscape)
